title: CapWealth Advisors LLC Cuts Stake in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
text: CapWealth Advisors LLC lowered its holdings in shares of Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) by 8.5% in the undefined quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The institutional investor owned 52,238 shares of the information services provider's stock after selling 4,855 shares during the quarter. CapWealth

title: The Stock Market Faces Make-or-Break Tests: The Fed's Interest-Rate Decision and Earnings From Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, and Microsoft
text: The S&P 500 has been in a bull market for more than three years, but the stock market could stumble, depending on the outcome of several important events this week. The Federal Reserve will announce its interest-rate decision on Wednesday, and five big technology companies will report earnings on Wednesday and Thursday.

title: Google Is the Latest Tech Titan to Go Nuclear to Power Its AI Ambitions
text: Google is buying nuclear power from a currently shuttered plant that NextEra Energy plans to restart. The companies are also collaborating to potentially develop new nuclear power plants.

title: Tech Giants Power Market: MSFT, GOOGL, AMZN, AAPL & AMD Lead Charge
text: Technology stocks are on fire, with the SPX, NDX and $DJI hitting record highs. Olivier Blanchard attributes this surge to A.I.

title: Billionaire Philippe Laffont Just Changed His Mind on This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock, Adding It to His List of Top Picks
text: Philippe Laffont's Coatue Management saw generative AI as a major threat to this tech incumbent. Recent developments may have pushed Laffont and his team to change their view.

title: Equities At Record Highs Despite A Slowing Economy
text: The equity market continues to ignore the government shutdown (perhaps treating it as a positive) and, more importantly, the slowdown signals emanating from the economy itself. For the week ending Friday, October 24th, the euphoria continued with the major indexes all up in the two percentage point range for the week, putting the month of October, which had been lackluster, solidly in the green (see table).

title: The ‘Magnificent Seven' have never been this important to the stock market — and a big test lies ahead
text: The stock market is getting ever-more reliant on the “Magnificent Seven,” raising the stakes for a jam-packed week of technology earnings that could decide whether Wall Street's momentum has more room to run.

title: Overlooked Stock: WULF Rallies on GOOGL Data Center Venture
text: TeraWulf (WULF) tapped highs it hasn't seen since early 2022 after Alphabet (GOOGL) tapped the company for a Google-backed data center venture. As George Tsilis notes, it's the latest Bitcoin mining company to get tapped for data center buildout and offers TeraWulf a huge boost for its balance sheet.

title: Big Tech earnings this week: What investors should expect
text: With five of the Big Tech giants reporting this week, Jessica Inskip weighs in on what the numbers could mean for AI demand and the market rally. Transcript: Caroline Woods: In terms of tech earnings, we have five of the big 7 on deck this week.

title: Alphabet vs. Snap: Which Digital Advertising Stock Has an Edge?
text: GOOGL's AI-powered Search and YouTube dominance fuel growth, while SNAP battles user retention and mounting competition risks.

title: Buy-Side 'Bogey' Number For Google Cloud Could Move Alphabet Stock
text: Google stock could pop when parent Alphabet reports Q3 earnings if the cloud business beats the buy side "bogey" number for revenue growth.

title: Mian: GOOGL to Show A.I. Resiliency, AAPL A.I.
text: Sheraz Mian turns to the slate of Mag 7 earnings on the docket this week, noting four of the five serving as leaders in the A.I. race. The one he doesn't see leading: Apple (AAPL).

title: 1 Incredible Reason to Buy Alphabet (GOOGL) Stock in November
text: Despite increasing competition, Alphabet has reported strong growth in search advertising. Its full-stack technology infrastructure, including AI models, custom AI chips, and data centers, is a competitive advantage.

title: GitHub unites OpenAI, Google and Anthropic AI agents in one place to bring 'order to the chaos'
text: GitHub announced Agent HQ, a new platform that will allow software developers to steer and monitor the work of multiple agents. Agents from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, xAI, Cognition and more are coming to Agent HQ.

title: NextEra Energy: Q3 Earnings Beat And Google Deal, Raising Price Target To $96
text: NextEra Energy remains a top utilities pick, blending defensive stability with AI-driven growth opportunities, and I reiterate my "Buy" rating. Q3 earnings beat EPS expectations, driven by strong Florida Power & Light performance and a new partnership with Google to restart the Duane Arnold nuclear plant. NEE's valuation is attractive; I raise my price target, projecting further upside as EPS growth, corporate deals, and AI tailwinds support fundamentals.

title: Microsoft's $135B stake in OpenAI, why Microsoft and Google are well-positioned for earnings
text: Morning Brief anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest market news for October 28, 2025. Julie speaks with Jessica Inskip of Stockbrokers.com to discuss Big Tech earnings due out this week.

title: 3 Stocks to Buy if We Are in An Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Market Bubble
text: Amazon has multiple businesses that would be unaffected if an AI bubble bursts. Most of Alphabet's revenue comes from its Google Search engine, which is in great shape.

title: Google to buy power from NextEra nuclear plant being revived
text: NextEra Energy Inc. plans to restart a nuclear power plant in Iowa, primarily to supply Google data centers.

title: Google investors have big expectations after stock's sharpest quarterly rally in 20 years
text: Google shares soared 38% in the third quarter, their best performance in two decades, and have continued rallying this month. The biggest catalyst in the period was last month's remedies ruling in the search antitrust case, as Google avoided a worst-case scenario.

title: Alphabet's stock performance hinges on the answers to these 3 big AI questions
text: Can Google's deal with Anthropic and its viral Gemini ‘Nano Banana' feature translate into an earnings beat for the Big Tech company?

title: Saudi AI firm Humain partners with Google, eyes deal with AWS
text: Saudi AI firm Humain's CEO Tareq Amin said on Tuesday the company has a partnership with Google and said there might be an upcoming significant collaboration with Amazon Web Services.

title: What Is One of the Best Tech Stocks to Buy Right Now?
text: Alphabet, which owns Google, has launched popular AI products, including AI Overviews and the Gemini app. It also provides custom-built AI chips.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy This Under-the-Radar Quantum Computing Stock Today
text: Alphabet's technology is best-in-class. Alphabet has massive cash flow to finance its quantum computing investments.

title: Google turns back to nuclear to power the AI age
text: Google is going nuclear
